author: peter.davies
content: I think the best thing to do is to do all gas computation as `Uint`. I will make a "gas and memory refactoring v2" that does this and other things in the meantime.

author: samwilsn
content: That could work. Is it possible for a block to go over `U256.MAX_VALUE` cumulative gas used?

author: samwilsn
content: Not that it ever would in practice, just curious theoretically.

author: peter.davies
content: There are a number of such impossible situations. It's not clear to me whether there is well defined behaviour in them. Some of them have tests written and various clients (including us) have refused to implement them.

author: peter.davies
content: We will need to formally address rules around impossible situations in due course.
